criteria: Understanding of Physical Activity vs. Exercise
Differentiation Between Health-Related and Skill-Related Fitness
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate understanding of the difference between physical activity and exercise.
Student shows minimal understanding, with significant misconceptions about physical activity and exercise.
Student identifies some differences but struggles to articulate the nuanced distinctions between physical activity and exercise.
Student accurately differentiates between physical activity and exercise, providing clear examples.
Student comprehensively explains the differences between physical activity and exercise, providing relevant examples and demonstrating a solid grasp of the concepts.
Student demonstrates a deep and nuanced understanding of the differences between physical activity and exercise, including how they contribute differently to overall health and fitness.
Student does not demonstrate understanding of the components of health-related fitness.
Student identifies one or two components of health-related fitness with limited explanation.
Student lists several components of health-related fitness but struggles to explain their importance or relationship to overall health.
Student accurately identifies and explains the key components of health-related fitness (e.g., cardiovascular endurance, muscular strength, muscular endurance, flexibility, body composition).
Student clearly explains the components of health-related fitness and gives examples of activities to improve each component. The relationship to overall health is discussed.

Student thoroughly explains and provides detailed examples of each component of health-related fitness, discussing how they contribute to long-term health and well-being. Demonstrates synthesis of information.
Student does not demonstrate understanding of the components of skill-related fitness.
Student identifies one or two components of skill-related fitness with limited explanation.
Student lists several components of skill-related fitness but struggles to explain their importance or relationship to specific activities.
Student accurately identifies and explains the key components of skill-related fitness (e.g., agility, balance, coordination, power, reaction time, speed).
Student clearly explains the components of skill-related fitness and gives examples of activities and sports where each component is important. The relationship to specific skills is discussed.

Student thoroughly explains and provides detailed examples of each component of skill-related fitness, discussing how they contribute to performance in various activities and sports. Demonstrates synthesis of information.
Student is unable to differentiate between health-related and skill-related fitness.
Student attempts to differentiate but demonstrates significant confusion between health-related and skill-related fitness components.
Student identifies some differences between health-related and skill-related fitness but lacks clarity in their explanations.
Student accurately distinguishes between health-related and skill-related fitness, providing examples of each.
Student comprehensively differentiates between health-related and skill-related fitness, explaining their distinct benefits and applications.
Student demonstrates a nuanced understanding of the interplay between health-related and skill-related fitness, explaining how they can complement each other for optimal health and performance.
